drow.document

Class DrowPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
            • javax.swing.JEditorPane
              • javax.swing.JTextPane
                • drow.document.DrowPage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable

    public class DrowPage
extends javax.swing.JTextPane

    DrowPage

    An extension of JTextPane, this class is the class that the user manipulates and populates with text. It handles the styling of the text and the absolute positioning of the page in the DrowDocument.

    Author:
    Simon O'Neill

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrowPage

        public DrowPage()

        Default Constructor

        Creates an empty page which can be used logically but will never be styled of displayed.

      • DrowPage

        public DrowPage(int pageNumber)

        Constructor used most of the time

        Creates a page, sets its width and height and calculates it X and Y, all based on the pageNumber.
        Parameters:
        pageNumber - - The number of the page in the document.
